paragraphs.text: In Season 5 of Sons of Anarchy, a television show about a biker gang in a tiny American town, a former U.S. marshal named Lee tries to get one of the gang’s imprisoned members, Otto, to snitch on himself, or his gang, or anybody, really. It’s this whole back-and-forth thing that happens several times throughout the season, Lee getting more and more aggressive in his means of attempting to force Otto to talk. Finally, come the 13th episode, Otto has had enough. He’s in an interrogation room, and there’s a two-way mirror in there and he knows Lee is on the other side, watching. A different law enforcement officer walks in, turns on a voice recorder, sits down, turns on a camcorder, and asks Otto to state his name for the record. Otto sighs, swallows, leans forward, pauses for a second, then sticks his tongue all the way out and slams his chin down onto the table, effectively biting off his own tongue. The officer freaks and runs out of the room. Otto picks up the tongue, then throws it at the mirror.
paragraphs.name: bb3d
0b7c
paragraphs.text: This is a weird question, but a legitimate one, I think. KD put up 40 points in the game on 16 shots, many of which were either wide-open 3s or dunks. And let me be clear: Those sorts of shots are certainly better for a team’s performance, yes. But what I’m saying is that, I mean, it just makes things a little less interesting as an observer. It’s fantastic to watch the Warriors when they get into their Total Team Destruction mode and do something silly like have 38 assists on 45 shots for the game or whatever. That’s great and beautiful basketball, obviously. It’s just that sometimes I miss a good Kevin Durant iso, you know what I’m saying? I miss him getting the ball, staring at the defense, then deciding, “You know what? Let me fuck up y’all’s life for the next few minutes,” and then going berserk, like he did to my beloved Spurs in Game 4 of their 2012 series when he scored 16 points in a row over a five-minute stretch.

paragraphs.name: 507d
paragraphs.text: I had never before in my life missed Steven Adams (home in OKC recovering from a concussion) more than I did right there and then. I halfway hoped the arena was all of a sudden gonna fill with the sound of breaking glass and then Adams was gonna come swaggering out of the tunnel on some “Stone Cold” Steve Austin shit, but alas. Nothing. Poor Russell just laid there, beaten, battered, his honor left undefended.

paragraphs.name: d329
paragraphs.text: It feels weird to say that the Warriors are anybody other than Steph Curry’s team, given that he was their best player when they won a championship in 2015 and also their best player when they won a record 73 regular-season games in 2016. But I don’t know. It’s starting to feel that way, isn’t it? I’m sure Golden State fans will argue otherwise — that it’s Steph’s team and that it will be Steph’s team as long as he’s there — and I get that. I understand that impulse. I appreciate the urge to stand up for him, because he absolutely deserves it. But again: I don’t know. Kevin has a higher scoring average than Steph, a higher rebounding average, higher win shares, a higher VORP, a higher BPM, and a higher PER. I’m not all the way ready to say that Durant snatched that particular title away from Steph, but I’m also not willing to ignore the conversation anymore, either.

paragraphs.name: 9edc
paragraphs.text: Man. I really don’t think so, no. When the Thunder are on offense, it looks like this: they’re swinging the ball around the 3-point line a bit, things are flowing, and then it ends up in Roberson’s hands and it’s like one of those time-travel movies they show on the Disney Channel where some kids travel back to see dinosaurs or whatever and someone hands a caveman a PlayStation Vita and the caveman is like, “What the fuck is this?” and he just stares at it and flips it over and shakes it and whatnot. That’s Roberson when he gets the ball. It’s wild to watch. Draymond, who was ““guarding”” Roberson during the game, sagged off of him 10, 15, 20 feet every time. There was one play where Roberson caught the ball on the left wing and Draymond legit just walked to the bench and sat down while Roberson prayed for all of the electricity in America to shut off so he could just set the ball on the floor and walk away without anyone seeing him. I don’t like it. It’s a little embarrassing. I hope Roberson starts shooting soon.

paragraphs.text: I know what you mean, and was stunned when he did that v Argentina at the Olympics. It was ruthless. And beautiful. » https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EGgm37H3nqY

paragraphs.name: faf1
paragraphs.text: That is evidence that KD is currently a more well rounded and impactful player — although Steph’s gravitational pull once he passes half-court probably helps KD and everyone else in ways that cannot be fully reciprocated — but that doesn’t necessarily answer the question of whose team it is. There are certainly times that it seems as if it is…

e4f0afff7875.title: It’d be Durant’s team wherever he chose to go, outside of Cleveland.

paragraphs.name: 492f
paragraphs.text: It’d be Durant’s team wherever he chose to go, outside of Cleveland. I’m a big fan of Curry, but he’s actually tradeable right now. Of course the Warriors would never trade him, but it could be done. Durant is a freak.

paragraphs.text: You’re right, OKC/GSW isn’t really a rivalry by any reasonable standard. I think you’re also right in pointing out that KD/Russ is definitely still a rivalry, though (and may be until the end of time at this rate). I wrote about this on my publication today, and I pretty much agree with everything you’ve written here. I do think there’s a chance that…

9d10ce1b5513.title: I signal it as more betrayal then rivalry.

paragraphs.text: I signal it as more betrayal then rivalry. They had a rivalry. Then Durant left to join the other side. He literally formed the Justice League and now Westbrook is learning what Kobe’s life was like back in 06 or AI in 01.

21033bb63e4f.title: Pretty poor description of what happened on the Russ-Zaza play.

paragraphs.name: 58b4
paragraphs.text: Pretty poor description of what happened on the Russ-Zaza play. The warriors were trying to foul at that point because it was the end of the quarter and they had a foul to give, so they wanted to break up the last play of the quarter. You could even see Kerr and others telling each other to foul the ballhandler leading up to the play. Zaza tried to…

38ac132c58a8.title: As a fan, I enjoy Westbrook’s basketball skills.

paragraphs.name: f9e8
paragraphs.text: As a fan, I enjoy Westbrook’s basketball skills. If I was a player, I wouldn’t want to play on his team either, because as a teammate he’s a pain in the ass. That’s how you lose a KD and end up with a bunch of Robersons and Morrows.

paragraphs.name: c35a
paragraphs.text: That’s not the question. That’s a variation on the question. That’s asking the question but dressing it up in different clothes. We all know the question. It’s the one that journos stopped asking for fear of losing access or fear of tarnishing their brand with perceived dickishness.

4a97e219c4ce.title: We are really at Peak Shea going into 2017.

paragraphs.name: a02f
paragraphs.text: We are really at Peak Shea going into 2017. I love this stuff! No-one else could’ve got me to click on this title. Except for Bill.
It’s a rivalry. Not a sports rivalry because OKC isnt good enough to compete. But it’s a personal level rivalry, which is honestly still very entertaining.
